title: 160th Anniversary of the United States Secret Service, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump commemorating the 160th anniversary of the United States Secret Service, dated July 2, 2025. It reflects on the agency's origins, established on April 14, 1865, initially to combat counterfeiting and later assigned the critical role of protecting the President following the assassination attempt on William McKinley in 1901.

The proclamation honors the dedication and bravery of the over 8,000 Secret Service agents who protect the President, Vice President, their families, and visiting dignitaries. It emphasizes the rigorous training agents undergo and their commitment to facing threats with courage and skill. The document also acknowledges past assassination attempts on various presidents, highlighting the agents' selflessness and sacrifice.

In conclusion, President Trump calls upon Americans to express gratitude to the Secret Service employees for their unwavering commitment to national security and the preservation of liberty, marking July 5, 2025, as a day of recognition for their service.
